title: Taskora Global reward-based earning platform (frontend pivot)

requirements.summary: Replace exchange-centric shell/navigation with Taskora Global reward-platform flow and remove Markets/Trade/Settings from the primary user journey.
acceptanceCriteria: When the app loads, the primary navigation and landing content are focused on earning rewards and VIP membership (not markets/trade/exchange pricing).
No user-facing page presents the app as a crypto exchange or shows exchange-specific labels like “Markets”/“Trade” as primary sections.

file_operations.description: Refactor the main shell to a Taskora Global flow: update PageType to dashboard/earn/vip/transfers/admin, set default to dashboard, remove exchange page imports (Markets/Trade/Settings), wire new Taskora pages, and keep admin gating using the authorization-based admin check (useIsCurrentUserAdmin). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Replace exchange header branding + nav labels with Taskora Global (Dashboard/Earn/VIP/Transfers/Admin), remove Markets/Trade/Settings, and switch logo reference to frontend/public/assets/generated/taskora-logo.dim_512x512.png. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create the Taskora Global Dashboard page component and ensure it is reachable from the shell as the default screen (no exchange copy).

requirements.summary: Implement a user Dashboard page showing balance, VIP status, earnings summaries, and recent activity with friendly states.
acceptanceCriteria: A signed-in user can view a dashboard with balance, VIP tier, and a recent activity list.
Loading, empty, and error states display user-friendly English messages (no raw stack traces).

file_operations.description: Implement dashboard UI: (a) available balance (from reward-platform account summary query/hook), (b) VIP tier/status, (c) today/this week earnings summary derived from approved claims timestamps, (d) recent activity list combining earning claims + deposit/withdraw request history; include explicit loading/empty/error states in English using existing error-mapping patterns. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add React Query queries for dashboard needs (account summary/balance, VIP status, earning history, transfer history) with consistent query keys for later invalidation. Use the authorization-based actor lifecycle patterns already used in the app. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add an Earn page listing earning opportunities and allow users to submit earning claims with Pending/Approved/Rejected history visibility.
acceptanceCriteria: The Earn page renders a list of earning items and a clear call-to-action to submit completion/claim.
Submitting a claim creates a new history entry with status “Pending”.
After admin approval, the user’s balance increases and the entry status becomes “Approved”.
If admin rejects, the entry status becomes “Rejected” and the user balance does not increase.

file_operations.description: Create Earn page UI that lists earning items (minimum Watch Ads + Complete Tasks) and provides a claim submission flow (intent/proof/user message). Render the user's claim history with clear English status labels (Pending/Approved/Rejected) and friendly loading/empty/error states. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add queries/mutations for earning items and claim submission/retrieval; on successful claim submission, invalidate earning history and dashboard/account summary query keys so the UI updates without reload. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Wire Earn page into the main navigation flow so it is reachable as a primary section (and gated behind login, consistent with the authorization component’s frontend guidance). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement VIP tiers page with comparison table and VIP upgrade requests that remain pending until admin approval.
acceptanceCriteria: VIP page displays multiple tiers (e.g., Free plus paid tiers) with clear English descriptions of benefits.
A signed-in user can submit a VIP upgrade request that appears as “Pending” in their account status/history.
An admin can approve the request; after approval, the user’s VIP tier updates on the user Dashboard and VIP page.

file_operations.description: Create VIP page with a tier comparison table (Free + paid tiers) and a CTA to request upgrade; show current tier and any pending request (status + optional admin message) with English labels. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add queries/mutations for VIP status and VIP upgrade requests; on success, invalidate VIP status and dashboard/account summary query keys so tier updates propagate immediately after admin approval. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Wire VIP page into the main navigation flow as a primary section and ensure it is login-gated per the authorization component’s frontend guidance. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement Transfers module for manual USDT deposits/withdrawals with admin-configured addresses, request creation, and clear manual-processing disclosure.
acceptanceCriteria: Transfers page shows USDT (TRC20) and USDT (ERC20) deposit addresses with copy-to-clipboard controls.
A deposit request can be created by the signed-in user and is stored with status “Pending” until admin completion.
A withdrawal request can be created by the signed-in user and is stored with status “Pending” until admin completion.
Clear English disclosure states that deposits/withdrawals are processed manually by the admin and the app does not connect to real blockchains or generate real deposit addresses automatically.

file_operations.description: Create Taskora Transfers page showing admin-configured USDT TRC20/ERC20 addresses with copy-to-clipboard controls (reuse CopyField) and sections to create deposit/withdrawal requests plus transfer history; include the manual-processing disclosure in English. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Update disclosure copy (still English) to fit Taskora Global transfers wording while preserving the required statement that there is no real blockchain connectivity and addresses are not generated automatically.

Add queries/mutations for USDT deposit addresses and creating deposit/withdrawal requests; on success, invalidate transfer history + dashboard/account summary query keys so pending items appear immediately. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Wire Transfers page into the primary navigation flow and ensure it is login-gated consistent with the authorization component’s frontend guidance. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement an admin-only Admin Panel UI to manage USDT addresses and process pending deposits/withdrawals, earning claims, and VIP upgrades.
acceptanceCriteria: Non-admin users cannot access the Admin Panel UI and receive a clear English access error/empty state.
Admin can update TRC20/ERC20 addresses; users see updated values on Transfers page without a manual refresh (standard query invalidation/refetch).
Admin can mark deposits and withdrawals as Completed; user history updates to show Completed status.
Admin can approve/reject earning claims; approval credits the user balance and updates the claim status accordingly.
Admin can approve/reject VIP upgrade requests; approval updates the user VIP tier.

file_operations.description: Create Taskora Admin Panel with tabs/sections for: setting TRC20/ERC20 addresses, processing pending deposits, processing pending withdrawals, reviewing earning claims (approve/reject with optional admin message), and reviewing VIP upgrade requests (approve/reject with optional admin message). Use clear English statuses and friendly empty/error states. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Wire the new Taskora Admin Panel page into admin navigation; gate access using the authorization component’s admin check and show clear English access denied UI for non-admin users. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add admin-only queries/mutations for updating addresses, listing pending deposits/withdrawals/claims/VIP requests, and processing actions; ensure on success the correct user-facing query keys are invalidated (addresses, transfer history, earning history, VIP status, dashboard/account summary). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add React Query hooks (queries + mutations) for reward-platform functions with cache invalidation and user-friendly errors.
acceptanceCriteria: All new user/admin actions trigger appropriate query invalidation and refresh relevant screens without requiring a full page reload.
Errors are displayed as user-friendly English toasts/messages using the existing error-mapping utility patterns.

file_operations.description: Centralize reward-platform React Query hooks for user flows (dashboard/account summary, earning items/claims, VIP status/requests, USDT addresses, deposit/withdraw requests) and admin flows (pending lists + processing). Implement consistent query keys and invalidate/refetch on mutations. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Ensure mutation error handling shows English toasts/messages using the existing getErrorMessage utility (no raw errors) and that success triggers immediate UI refresh via query invalidation. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Ensure all admin processing actions use user-friendly English toasts/messages via getErrorMessage and trigger immediate query refresh through invalidation. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Update metadata and in-app branding to Taskora Global reward/earning platform.
acceptanceCriteria: Browser tab title and meta description reflect Taskora Global’s reward/earning platform purpose (not exchange wording).
Header branding shows “Taskora Global” and matches the new navigation structure.

file_operations.description: Update HTML title and meta description to Taskora Global reward/earning platform wording (remove exchange/trading language).
Update header brand text to “Taskora Global” and align navigation labels with the reward-platform sections; use the new logo at frontend/public/assets/generated/taskora-logo.dim_512x512.png.

requirements.summary: Apply a cohesive modern rewards/fintech SaaS visual theme distinct from the exchange styling with strong contrast/readability.
acceptanceCriteria: The app has a consistent, professional visual theme across Dashboard/Earn/VIP/Transfers/Admin pages.
Theme avoids a default blue/purple look unless it is clearly transformed into a distinct brand palette.
All key UI elements meet strong contrast/readability expectations (buttons, text, cards, tables).

file_operations.description: Replace the current exchange-oriented color tokens with a distinct Taskora Global dark SaaS palette (background/surface/primary/accent/destructive/muted/etc.), ensuring accessible contrast and consistent typography/spacing.
Adjust extended theme values that are exchange-specific (e.g., glow shadows) to align with the new Taskora Global palette and ensure consistent styling across cards/tables/buttons.

Create a shared layout wrapper for Taskora pages (common page header area, consistent spacing, optional background pattern/hero treatment) and use it from Dashboard/Earn/VIP/Transfers/Admin pages for cohesion.

requirements.summary: Add new Taskora Global generated static image assets and update UI to use them instead of the exchange logo.
acceptanceCriteria: All required generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced by the UI via static paths.
The header shows the new Taskora Global logo asset (not the current exchange-logo file).

file_operations.description: Add generated static asset: Taskora Global logo mark (flat vector style) at frontend/public/assets/generated/taskora-logo.dim_512x512.png.
Add generated static asset: hero illustration (modern rewards dashboard on laptop/phone, dark SaaS aesthetic) at frontend/public/assets/generated/taskora-hero.dim_1400x800.png.
Add generated static asset: abstract dark background pattern at frontend/public/assets/generated/taskora-bg.dim_1600x900.png.
Add generated static asset: icon set (ads/play, checklist/tasks, VIP crown) at frontend/public/assets/generated/taskora-icons.dim_128x128.png.

Switch header logo reference from frontend/public/assets/generated/exchange-logo.dim_512x512.png to frontend/public/assets/generated/taskora-logo.dim_512x512.png and ensure alt text/branding matches Taskora Global.

Render the new hero/background assets in the dashboard (use frontend/public/assets/generated/taskora-hero.dim_1400x800.png and frontend/public/assets/generated/taskora-bg.dim_1600x900.png) to replace exchange visuals.
